86215e0f-2014-4bfa-a71c-2a4958ae3c3f: A bonded object can be used once per day to restore any one sorcerer {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
de2e069c-cc5d-4c4d-91e2-103d11e35681: A crossblooded bloodline combines the powers of two distinct heritages. In most cases, sorcerers with this bloodline are the offspring of two sorcerers from different ancestries, but occasionally a crossblooded sorcerer arises from the conjunction of other powers. A draconic sorcerer who is also the culmination of a great destiny, an abyssal sorcerer from a family that dealt with devils, and an arcane sorcerer raised from birth by fey are all possible sources for crossblooded bloodlines.
46dee21f-a12a-4876-8c24-b31c61766744: A crossblooded sorcerer gains an additional bloodline as a secondary bloodline. She receives only the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} from this bloodline.
c2ee342a-5658-401c-8a00-4d9f25fdfb68: A crossblooded sorcerer has one fewer {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} known at each level than regular sorcerer.
e1be297e-d76f-4b8a-a679-36ee18587c41:
A nine-tailed heir chooses a sorcerer's bloodline as usual, but she will not learn any additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} derived from her bloodline.
At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir receives one bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The nine-tailed heir must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.
8e09ae1c-3453-4bee-b4ad-20acb4c97034: Additional class skill from the Abyssal bloodline.
0ed93c38-19ed-49cd-a8f5-c98bd0ace73b: Additional class skill from the arcane bloodline.
52837b5d-3edb-443e-9505-90a4dcdec951: Additional class skill from the celestial bloodline.
f7ff30a7-2421-4bf4-ad75-eda19edcc0b6: Additional class skill from the draconic bloodline.
ade590a0-bfbf-4dc4-a7c3-a4fa9a47578a: Additional class skill from the elemental bloodline.
1403abd1-f40b-4292-9ed2-de880e70c323: Additional class skill from the fey bloodline.
de0f48d4-7f0d-44f2-bcbe-03df3befdc40: Additional class skill from the infernal bloodline.
7873d555-74e3-4290-aafb-670210e28d62: Additional class skill from the serpentine bloodline.
f0519888-3304-4cbf-9f43-22e1cb3d7b20: Additional class skill from the undead bloodline.
a5e5f9ac-0663-4e6e-b259-b09abdef9e6e: All {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} that you cast will deal acid {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} instead. This also changes the spell's type to an acid spell.
41b08433-e253-4f05-ac2c-094bf97b9bad: All {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} that you cast will deal cold {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} instead. This also changes the spell's type to a cold spell.
6d47d9fc-38d4-4389-b0fb-8bb4c5090564: All {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} that you cast will deal electricity {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} instead. This also changes the spell's type to an electricity spell.
41ab6ffc-4efa-4faa-9957-2869aadff47a: All {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} that you cast will deal fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} instead. This also changes the spell's type to a fire spell.
4e6806b8-0ba5-4d84-914f-c2a16e97573a: At 15th level, pick one {g|Encyclopedia:Magic_School}school of magic{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} you cast from that school increases by +2. This {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} stacks with the bonus granted by Spell Focus.
231d346b-2463-4a76-b380-5d0ef3eb76b3: At 15th level, whenever you cast a summoning {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that conjures more than one creature, add one to the total number of creatures summoned.
0c2eefd6-5c30-4d82-9518-45ec49430b43: At 15th level, you become immune to grapple, entangle, slow, and difficult terrain.
1e3a9bc7-ac8e-4854-bbeb-a039efba8f6d: At 15th level, you can become incorporeal for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per sorcerer level. While in this form, you gain the incorporeal subtype. You take no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from non-magic weapons. You also take only half damage from any source not dealing ghost, holy, divine, or {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}force damage{/g}. You can use this ability once per day.
da6c9896-1d02-4b33-833e-dbd1a5c1b229: At 15th level, you gain +30 feet to your base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
504e64a8-94b3-4d65-8067-2ffac9f35f25: At 15th level, you gain immunity to {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
d521a3ee-e402-4407-a231-a6b712afe7ad: At 15th level, you gain the burrow ability. While burrowing, you have a +8 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}, but you can't take any {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} except moving. You may use burrow as often as desired.
5eb2c553-8f99-41b6-9438-51bb8338dfa9: At 15th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} against evil {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and spells cast by evil creatures equal to 11 + your sorcerer level.
948f52b0-6d0d-4c9c-9bd5-66d65ff2d910: At 15th level, you get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) made to overcome a creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}. This bonus stacks with the one from the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g} Penetration and Greater Spell Penetration {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}.
d8794f2e-a431-42d5-bfd5-77453d699290:
At 15th level, you may summon a host of insects. This power acts as creeping doom, but the swarms' poison inflicts {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and any creature other than you sharing a space with a swarm is entangled. You may use this ability once per day.
Creeping Doom: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side 4 spider swarms. The summoned swarms appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
The swarms have 60 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} each and deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of damage with their swarm attack plus poison and distraction. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} to resist their poison and distraction effects is equal to the save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this spell. Creatures caught in multiple swarms only take damage and make saves once.
Distraction: A creature with this ability can nauseate the creatures that it damages. Any living creature that takes damage from a creature with the distraction ability is nauseated for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}; a Fortitude save negates the effect.
Poison: Swarm â€” injury; Fortitude save; frequency: 1/round for 6 rounds; effect: 1d4 Con; cure: 1 save.
cd422f78-a5b7-420d-bf7a-e4fa62f76594: At 1st level, a sorcerer gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. At each such opportunity, she can choose a metamagic feat, spell focus feat, or any other {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcaster{/g} feat. The sorcerer must still meet all prerequisites for a bonus feat, including {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} minimums.
71ffe019-238d-4d33-8fc1-14bad9d88146: At 1st level, an overwhelming mage gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome a target's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every 6 levels thereafter.
7255a12e-c8e2-460f-bace-aaa8269fd037: At 1st level, you can cause a creature to become shaken as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This effect persists for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your sorcerer level (minimum 1). Multiple touches do not stack, but they do add to the duration. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
89ab6a69-37c1-4ecc-a2f2-ce5fa10f91c4: At 1st level, you can cause a creature to burst out laughing for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. A laughing creature can only take a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} but can defend itself normally. Once a creature has been affected by laughing touch, it is immune to its effects for 24 hours. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. This is a mind-affecting effect.
582d3f74-c8bc-4336-88d3-ed7c95039f01: At 1st level, you can form a powerful bond with an object or a creature. This bond can take one of two forms: a familiar or a bonded object. A familiar is a magical pet that enhances your {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and senses, while a bonded object is an item you can use to cast additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
255d4ce4-6a07-47ae-ba98-6f3f9404e357: At 1st level, you can grow claws as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. These claws are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}, allowing you to make two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} as a full attack using your full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. These attacks deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each (1d3 if you are Small) plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier. At 5th level, these claws are considered magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}. At 7th level, the damage increases by one step to 1d6 points of damage (1d4 if you are Small). At 11th level, these claws become flaming weapons, each dealing an additional 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a successful hit. You can use your claws for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.
65e06a2b-1df2-4d7b-9364-554bc9b51f31: At 1st level, you can grow fangs as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. These fangs are treated as a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} inflicting {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier (1d3 if you are Small) plus poison (Bite â€” injury; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + 1/2 your sorcerer level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier); frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds; effect: 1 Con damage; cure: 1 save). At 5th level, these fangs are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} and the poison damage increases to 1d2 Con. At 7th level, your poison requires 2 successful saves to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g}. At 11th level, your poison damage increases to 1d4 Con. You can use your fangs for a number of rounds per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
4832f22e-3833-469e-a2f9-1f9689585902: At 1st level, you form a close bond with an animal companion. Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the sorcerer advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their master reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.
8abd96e0-190d-4617-821b-d1cc434449f3: At 20th level, elemental power surges through your body. You gain immunity to sneak attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}.
1fb5cdcf-1e6b-4d61-ad04-8ddd80144635: At 20th level, elemental power surges through your body. You gain immunity to sneak attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}.
66580247-6757-459a-840c-284d3949be6a: At 20th level, elemental power surges through your body. You gain immunity to sneak attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}.
dcb37e39-98bc-4151-ae22-af16223a1f09: At 20th level, elemental power surges through your body. You gain immunity to sneak attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}.
57e4fed8-d085-46e2-a2b8-77452e1632fd: At 20th level, the power of the Abyss flows through you. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to electricity and poison. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} to acid 10, cold 10, and fire 10.
ab3e7009-a913-467e-b3d4-e2f877dcdf89: At 20th level, you become infused with the power of the heavens. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to acid, cold, and petrification, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} electricity 10, resist fire 10, and a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against poison.
3dcd6d50-a24e-44dd-85b5-fc8c246e7c9a: At 20th level, you gain ability to turn yourself into a Large spirit Naga (as beast shape III) and back again at will. You also become immune to poison and paralysis. You may use serpent's fang as often as desired, and you may choose to inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to any {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}.
1c8f13af-6ca3-4ee7-ad9a-f6221cc242cd: At 20th level, your body surges with arcane power. All your {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} made to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or use a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} are automatic successes.
12603489-c400-458e-8649-9c4e41c262cb: At 20th level, your draconic heritage becomes manifest. You gain immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet.
6c75708f-3173-4273-8dfc-2c9d5151e4c7: At 20th level, your draconic heritage becomes manifest. You gain immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet.
d2aab46c-d151-48cc-94c2-6ab20702a097: At 20th level, your draconic heritage becomes manifest. You gain immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet.
93716175-14c3-4b66-a476-b9bde3dc3f3d: At 20th level, your draconic heritage becomes manifest. You gain immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet.
8d1b6b67-64c1-4592-92d9-2a1a65c02c49: At 20th level, your form becomes infused with vile power. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to fire and poison. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} to acid 10 and cold 10.
06a33f14-c0c4-44d5-b457-53b6233b8695: At 20th level, your form begins to rot and undead see you as one of them. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to cold, paralysis, and sleep. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/â€”. You receive a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} made against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g} cast by undead.
eee80cde-2468-4d8e-a87c-5529e64d32a7: At 20th level, your soul becomes one with the world of the fey. You gain immunity to poison and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/cold iron. Once per day, you can cast cloak of dreams as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} using your sorcerer level as your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
5c38a0ff-e6a9-4930-a537-5123c0ff90f7: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a nine-tailed heir gains Magical Tail as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. If the nine-tailed heir already has nine tails, each additional time the feat is taken, the sorcerer gains one additional daily use of the lowest level Magical Tail ability not already affected by this effect.
bf94c6e3-bfe9-455c-9ee0-8c4ea96fad89:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Animate Dead: This spell raises {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+2 skeletons. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
7908215f-1a2c-430f-b9c2-e4df1732cbba:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Banishment: This spell is a more powerful version of the dismissal spell. It enables you to force extraplanar creatures out of your home plane. As many as 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} of creatures per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} can be banished in a 30-foot radius; creatures who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first.
327793bc-8b8f-4828-a1fa-063324b3cc4d:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Banishment: This spell is a more powerful version of the dismissal spell. It enables you to force extraplanar creatures out of your home plane. As many as 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} of creatures per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} can be banished in a 30-foot radius; creatures who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first.
Dismissal: This spell forces an extraplanar creature back to its proper plane if it fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. If the spell is successful, the creature is instantly whisked away.
6dd77889-7a01-4643-badf-7c7a60a83b6b:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Bless: This spell fills your allies with courage. Each ally gains a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects.
Bless dispels bane.
67f476f5-a17d-430d-9c91-c76ec7a80389:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Break Enchantment: This spell frees victims from enchantments, transmutations, and curses. Break enchantment can reverse even an instantaneous effect. For each such effect, you make a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level, maximum +15) against a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 11 + caster level of the effect. Success means that the creature is free of the spell, curse, or effect.
a7e9d90a-e6e4-4187-a1c3-c798f5220f56:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Bull's Strength: The subject becomes stronger. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} for 5 minutes, adding the usual benefits to {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and other uses of the Strength modifier. Enhancement bonuses do not stack with other enhancement bonuses, for example with bonuses from belts.
50d9d0b2-85cc-47fb-af4d-ada8925f62eb:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Burning Hands (Acid): This spell always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (earth). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
Any creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
e1af6e30-576c-4878-9232-dd1fa3eaa8a3:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Burning Hands (Cold): This spell always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (water). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
Any creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
df02dd98-cafa-477e-be8d-0f2e9def0d1f:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Burning Hands (Electricity): This spell always deals a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} determined by your element (air). In addition, the subtype of this spell changes to match the energy type of your element.
Any creature in the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
5ab7e33a-9c52-4977-8cf5-776eb2ee3b58:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Burning Hands: Any creature in the area of the flames takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
abf8863c-32dc-4ba6-a8db-bcee8224a353:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Cause Fear: The affected creature becomes frightened. If the subject succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}, it is instead shaken for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Creatures with 6 or more {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} are immune to this effect. Cause fear counters and dispels remove fear.
6244f801-2b17-4d5b-94d9-b724e4f17d6b:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Cause Fear: The affected creature becomes frightened. If the subject succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}, it is instead shaken for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Creatures with 6 or more {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} are immune to this effect. Cause fear dispels remove fear.
14cc7277-d467-4bb7-9a89-53e3910d4f89:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Changestaff: This spell changes an ordinary quarterstaff into a treant creature. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
c6508d62-9bb5-4d62-9010-bcd290476b5d:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Clashing Rocks: You create two Colossal-sized masses of rock, dirt, and stone and slam them together against a single creature between them. The clashing rocks appear up to 30 feet away from the target on opposite sides and rush toward it with a mighty grinding crash. You must make a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit the target with the rocks. The clashing rocks ignore {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} and cover. A creature struck by the clashing rocks takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}20d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} and is knocked prone.
If the clashing rocks miss the target, the target still takes 10d6 points of bludgeoning {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from falling rocks and is knocked prone. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} reduces this damage to half and the target remains standing. Creatures other than the target that occupy the spaces where the clashing rocks appear or within their path must also make Reflex saves or take 10d6 points of bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone (save for half and remain standing).
f2143a65-d2b4-4b24-a0ca-7eea5fa7229f:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Crushing Despair: An invisible cone of despair causes great sadness in the subjects. Each affected creature takes a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. Crushing despair dispels good hope.
7d01c66c-78b7-4a87-823c-44e9804eb139:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Deep Slumber: This spell causes a magical slumber to come upon 10 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} of creatures; those who are closest to the spell's point of origin are affected first. HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted. Sleeping creatures are {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}. Slapping or wounding awakens an affected creature, but normal noise does not. This spell does not target {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} creatures, constructs, or undead creatures.
d7b48d83-82d3-4505-a6cf-eef5144aaf95:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Delay Poison: The subject becomes temporarily immune to poison. Any poison in its system or any poison to which it is exposed during the spell's duration does not affect the subject until the spell's duration has expired. Delay poison does not {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} that poison may have already done.
b8d6f4c9-081b-4d64-8fa6-9d184eba2f3c:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dimension Door: You instantly transfer yourself from your current location to any other spot within range.
ae4b3918-c422-4bc1-a272-0249b6249bef:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dismissal: This spell forces an extraplanar creature back to its proper plane if it fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}.
21c9b4f3-bf2d-4924-931f-940750efff70:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dispel Magic, Greater: This functions as a targeted dispel magic, but it can dispel multiple spells, starting with the highest level spells and proceeding to lower level spells.
467e899f-d8e9-4f5a-9da5-bdd5fffe4e71:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dispel Magic: One object, creature, or spell is the target of the dispel magic spell. You make one dispel {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) and compare that to the spell with highest caster level ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 11 + the spell's caster level). If successful, that spell ends.
If not, compare the same result to the spell with the next highest caster level. Repeat this process until you have dispelled one spell affecting the target, or you have failed to dispel every spell.
8fa53b9e-4998-4257-86a3-b6ac06769b22:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dispel Magic: You can use dispel magic to end one ongoing spell that has been cast on a creature.
You make one dispel {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) and compare that to the spell with highest caster level ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 11 + the spell's caster level). If successful, that spell ends. If not, compare the same result to the spell with the next highest caster level. Repeat this process until you have dispelled one spell affecting the target, or you have failed to dispel every spell.
36f44e16-377a-4f96-bdac-f1c40d827d22:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dragonkind I: You become a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Medium{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain a +4 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, a breath weapon, and resistance to one element. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g}), two claws (1d6), and two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d4). Your breath weapon and resistance depend on the type of your dragon prototype. You can only use the breath weapon once per casting of this spell. All breath weapons deal 6d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage.
f032feda-2024-4ff7-a4a1-3dc491f0fa39:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dragonkind II: This spell functions as dragonkind I except that it also allows you to assume the form of a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Large{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain the following abilities: a +6 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 5/magic, and resistance to one element. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}), two claws (1d8), two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d6), and one tail slap attack (1d8). You can only use the breath weapon twice per casting of this spell (when you use it, the duration of your breath weapon ability is reduced by 1/2 your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} in minutes). All breath weapons deal 8d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. Line breath weapons increase to 80-foot lines and cones increase to 40-foot cones.
98d9ee61-f77d-4d23-bce9-7fdddc058b51:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Dragonkind III: This spell functions as dragonkind II save that it also allows you to take the form of a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Huge{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain the following abilities: a +10 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +8 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +8 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, blindsight with a range of 30 feet, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 10/magic, frightful presence ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equal to the DC for this spell) and immunity to one element. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g}), two claws (2d6), two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d8), and one tail slap attack (2d6). You can use the breath weapon as often as you like, but you must wait 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} between uses. All breath weapons deal 12d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. Line breath weapons increase to 100-foot lines and cones increase to 50-foot cones.
a7c856ce-39c2-4ff6-bb64-1ef7df4f510b:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Elemental Body I: When you cast this spell, you can assume the form of a small air elemental, small earth elemental, small fire elemental, or small water elemental. The abilities you gain depend upon the type of elemental into which you change. Elemental abilities based on {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} use the size of the elemental you transform into to determine their effect.
180c2c43-25b2-4309-be46-f748c728dc23:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Elemental Body II: When you cast this spell, you can assume the form of a medium air elemental, medium earth elemental, medium fire elemental, or medium water elemental. The abilities you gain depend upon the type of elemental into which you change. Elemental abilities based on {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} use the size of the elemental you transform into to determine their effect.
6e736a86-e47e-4b14-a1c8-28e1da637c6e:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Elemental Body III: When you cast this spell, you can assume the form of a large air elemental, large earth elemental, large fire elemental, or large water elemental. The abilities you gain depend upon the type of elemental into which you change. Elemental abilities based on {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} use the size of the elemental you transform into to determine their effect.
16f209b2-0245-4208-8844-5b547157c792:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Elemental Body IV: When you cast this spell, you can assume the form of a Huge air elemental, huge earth elemental, huge fire elemental, or huge water elemental. The abilities you gain depend upon the type of elemental into which you change. Elemental abilities based on {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} use the size of the elemental you transform into to determine their effect. You are also immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and sneak attacks while in elemental form and gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/â€”.
24c83edb-763e-492b-9641-c06c71a91608:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Elemental Swarm: This spell opens a portal to an Elemental Plane and summons elementals from it. When the spell is complete, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g} large elementals appear. Five {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} later, 1d4 huge elementals appear. Five rounds after that, one greater elemental appears. The summoned elementals appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
7aab9058-93c6-48a4-a3ff-0a3017460e27:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Energy Drain: You point your finger and fire a black ray of negative energy that suppresses the life force of any living creature it strikes. You must make a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit. If you hit, the subject gains {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} temporary negative levels. Negative levels stack.
Twenty-four hours after gaining them, the subject must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = energy drain spell's save DC) for each negative level. If the save succeeds, that negative level is removed. If it fails, that negative level becomes permanent.
An undead creature struck by the ray gains 10d4 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} for 1 hour.
d67fedca-9a8b-4cbc-9884-295223dd55d1:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Entangle: This spell causes tall grass, weeds, and other plants to wrap around creatures in the area of effect or those that enter the area. Creatures that fail their {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} gain the entangled condition for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
The entire area of effect is considered difficult terrain while the effect lasts.
b10f5d41-c790-4996-949b-d7de714ce3d9:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
False Life: You harness the power of unlife to grant yourself a limited ability to avoid {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}. While this spell is in effect, you gain temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} + 1 per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +10).
b45256b0-6092-4b7b-a20a-0b5f4ec47274:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Fear: An invisible cone of terror causes each living creature in the area to become panicked unless it succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. If cornered, a panicked creature begins cowering. If the Will save succeeds, the creature is instead shaken for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
f15c1a2f-ce0c-44de-a18f-69156f6c4527:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Finger of Death: This spell instantly delivers 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. If the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} succeeds, it instead takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of damage + 1 point per caster level.
a07f1c1a-6fda-4af3-a7a1-0e656dd5ad20:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Firebrand: You mark several allies with a flaming rune. This rune does not cause {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, and sheds light as if it were a torch. While the firebrand burns, any creature it marks is immune to damage from any fire spell you cast. All of the target's weapons (both natural and manufactured) inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}+1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a hit (this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} fire damage stacks with any amount of fire damage a creature's weapons might already inflict). At any point during the spell's duration, a creature bearing a firebrand can launch a beam of fire at any target within 30 feet as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. This ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals 6d6 points of fire damage. Once a creature uses its firebrand to fire a ray in this manner, the effects of the spell end for that creature.
586f1811-0ef9-4901-9fd8-7220db144ed6:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Flame Strike: A flame strike evokes a vertical column of divine fire. The spell deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d6). Half the damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, but the other half results directly from divine power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} to fire-based {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
fa21ad32-6d5c-413f-8458-53e637ed67b2:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Frightful Aspect: You become a larger, awful version of yourself. You gain the following abilities: a +6 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/magic, and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. You also emit an aura that emanates 30 feet from you. Enemy creatures within the aura are shaken. Each time a creature shaken by this aura hits you with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}, that creature becomes frightened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
cbbbfa2f-4924-4535-afc2-58b150c1a240:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Hellfire Ray: A blast of hellfire blazes from your hands. You can fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} beyond 11th (to a maximum of three rays at 19th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per caster level (maximum 15d6). Half the damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, but the other half results directly from unholy power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g}.
eb3ba526-3b66-4ce4-8833-af7dc9fde083:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Hideous Laughter: This spell afflicts the subject with uncontrollable laughter. It collapses into gales of manic laughter, falling prone. The subject can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} while laughing, but is not considered {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}. After the spell ends, it can act normally. On the creature's next turn, it may attempt a new {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} to end the effect. A creature with an {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} score of 2 or lower is not affected.
8403e9e8-01f3-4079-a4e4-b6934a9f4dd1:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Hold Monster: This spell functions like hold person, except that it affects any living creature that fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}.
8352ef0f-7e9e-44e1-80b8-4cb6aae27007:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Hold Person: The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, even speech. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} on its turn, the subject may attempt a new {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} to end the effect. This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} that does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
bbb00af5-14a0-44df-b52f-056def6779d8:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Horrid Wilting: This spell evaporates moisture from the body of each subject living creature, causing flesh to wither and crack and crumble to dust. This deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d6). This spell is especially devastating to water elementals and plant creatures, which instead take 1d8 points of damage per caster level (maximum 20d8).
7bfbfc48-291b-4152-96b5-24398c018346:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Hypnotism: Your gestures and droning incantation fascinate nearby creatures, causing them to stop and stare blankly at you. {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}Roll{/g} 2d4 to see how many total {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} of creatures you affect.
96548d45-c0ac-421f-b592-dcc5e1c340b0:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Invisibility: The touched creature becomes invisible.
If a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} is required, an invisible creature has a +20 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on its {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. The spell ends if the subject {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} any creature. For the purposes of this spell, an attack includes any spell targeting a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}Actions{/g} directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon monsters and have them attack, cut the ropes holding a rope bridge while enemies are on the bridge, remotely trigger traps, open a portcullis to release attack dogs, and so forth. If the subject attacks directly, however, it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Spells such as bless that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.
a9b992bc-6391-493b-8de9-66d6859e80bd:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Mage Armor: An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds the subject of a mage armor spell, providing a +4 armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} reduction. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal armor.

At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Magic Missile: A missile of magical energy darts forth from your fingertip and strikes its target, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}force damage{/g}.
The missile strikes unerringly, even if the target is in melee combat, so long as it has less than total cover or total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}.
For every two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} beyond 1st, you gain an additional missile â€” two at 3rd level, three at 5th, four at 7th, and the maximum of five missiles at 9th level or higher.

Creatures in the mind fog take a â€“10 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g}. The fog is stationary and lasts for 30 minutes.

A creature that fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} against this spell falls to the ground and prostrates itself before you, believing it bows before a divine presence. These creatures are considered to be {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} for the duration of the spell. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} on its turn, a target of this spell may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect; this is a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g} that does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. A creature that recovers from this spell early after being affected by it for at least 1 round takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} drain and is staggered for 1d4 rounds. The subject gains resist energy 10 against the energy type chosen, meaning that each time the creature is subjected to such damage (whether from a natural or magical source), that damage is reduced by 10 points before being applied to the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}. The value of the energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} granted increases to 20 points at 7th level and to a maximum of 30 points at 11th level. Transformation: You become a fighting machine â€“ stronger, tougher, faster, and more skilled in combat. Your mindset changes so that you relish combat and you can't cast spells, even from magic items.
You gain a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +5 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saves{/g}, and proficiency with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}. Your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} equals your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} (but not higher than 20), which may give you multiple {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.

True Seeing: You confer on the subject the ability to see all things as they actually are. The subject sees through normal and magical darkness, notices secret doors hidden by magic, sees the exact locations of creatures or objects under blur or displacement effects, sees invisible creatures or objects normally, sees through illusions, and sees the true form of polymorphed, changed, or transmuted things.
8989bd83-f616-49fd-8bbd-7692c925a266:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Undeath to Death: This spell snuffs out the life force of undead creatures, killing them instantly. The spell slays {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} worth of undead creatures per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d4). Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first; among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first. No creature of 9 or more HD can be affected, and HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.
a42370cf-294f-414a-b9d9-92a834965929:
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels.
Unholy Aura: A malevolent darkness surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by good creatures, and weakening good creatures when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}. Unlike the effect of protection from good, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by good creatures.
Second, each warded creature gains spell resistance 25 against good spells and spells cast by good creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects the recipient from possession and mental influence, just as protection from good does.
Finally, if a good creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a warded creature, the offending attacker takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} (Fortitude negates).

Vampiric Touch: You must succeed on a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Your touch deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum 10d6). You gain temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to the damage you deal. You can't gain more than the subject's current hit points + the subject's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score (which is enough to kill the subject). 704d9d6c-1af9-4c8c-b027-37c1c7e57e41: At 9th level, you can apply an aura of heaven on yourself for a minute. This aura provides a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made or effects created by evil creatures to all allies within 20 feet. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to your sorcerer level.
e55b459f-1ad0-4a8c-b4c5-59ccdc3f81b6: At 9th level, you can call down a column of hellfire. This 10-foot-radius burst does {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per sorcerer level. Those caught in the area of your blast receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Good creatures that fail their saves are shaken for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your sorcerer level. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your sorcerer level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. At 9th level, you can use this ability once per day. At 17th level, you can use this ability twice per day. At 20th level, you can use this ability three times per day. This power has a range of 60 feet.
bf0f4791-5e52-4b8f-9352-15557cf4bf7a:
At 9th level, you can cause a swarm of skeletal arms to burst from the ground to rip and tear at your foes. The skeletal arms erupt from the ground in a 20-foot-radius burst.
Anyone in this area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g} per sorcerer level. Those caught in the area receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Those who fail the save are unable to move for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your sorcerer level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
At 9th level, you can use this ability once per day. At 17th level, you can use this ability twice per day. At 20th level, you can use this ability three times per day.
8b2b1025-4612-4339-a577-7665e10e2cd8:
At 9th level, you can turn invisible for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to your sorcerer level. This ability functions as greater invisibility. These rounds need not be consecutive.
Greater Invisibility: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like invisibility, except that it doesn't end if the subject {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
Invisibility: The creature becomes invisible. If a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} is required, an invisible creature has a +20 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on its {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. The spell ends if the subject attacks any creature. For purposes of this spell, an attack includes any spell targeting a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. Exactly who is a foe depends on the invisible character's perceptions. {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}Actions{/g} directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon monsters and have them attack, cut the ropes holding a rope bridge while enemies are on the bridge, remotely trigger traps, open a portcullis to release attack dogs, and so forth. If the subject attacks directly, however, it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Spells such as bless that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.

Those caught in the area of your blast receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Creatures that fail their saves gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to acid until the end of your next turn. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your sorcerer level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. At 9th level, you can use this ability once per day. At 17th level, you can use this ability twice per day. At 20th level, you can use this ability three times per day. This power has a range of 60 feet.

At 9th level, your bloodline makes you a natural receptacle of divine energy. You can channel energy once per day. This energy can be used to cause or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} damage, depending on the creatures targeted.
A sorcerer channels positive energy and can choose to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to undead creatures or to heal living creatures.
Channeling positive energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the sorcerer. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of damage at 9th level plus 1d6 points of damage for every two sorcerer levels beyond 9th (4d6 at 11th, 5d6 at 13th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the sorcerer's level + the sorcerer's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} totalâ€”all excess healing is lost.
This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
4e32ace1-a56d-4053-ac17-7b6d4f97ffd1:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline, and now its ancient power flows through your veins.
Although most consider it to be the weakest and most feral of the chromatic dragons, the white dragon makes up for its lack of cunning with sheer ferocity.

Few creatures are more cruel and fearsome than the mighty red dragon. King of the chromatics, this terrible beast brings ruin and death to the lands that fall under its shadow.

Gold dragons are the epitome of virtue. Other metallic dragons revere their gold cousins as the agents of divine forces and the paragons of dragonkind, and often seek them for advice or aid.

Green dragons dwell in the ancient forests of the world, prowling under towering canopies in search of prey. Of all the chromatic dragons, green dragons are perhaps the easiest to deal with diplomatically.

14e89253-b3a1-4ce0-bea3-d57df81fe881: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} all undead creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the sorcerer. The amount of damage inflicted is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of damage at 9th level plus 1d6 points of damage for every two sorcerer levels beyond 9th (4d6 at 11th, 5d6 at 13th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the sorcerer's level + the sorcerer's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier.
78d8d364-07ba-4686-a2d0-bd1121fb4298: Channeling positive energy causes a burst that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} all living creatures in a 30-foot radius centered on the sorcerer. The amount of damage healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of damage at 9th level plus 1d6 points of damage for every two sorcerer levels beyond 9th (4d6 at 11th, 5d6 at 13th, and so on).
061f7b99-fa81-49be-a4c5-825394ed2954:
Distraction: A creature with this ability can nauseate the creatures that it {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g}. Any living creature that takes damage from a creature with the distraction ability is nauseated for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}; a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + 1/2 creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g} + creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g} modifier) negates the effect.
Poison: Swarm â€” injury; Fortitude save (DC 13); frequency: 1/round for 6 rounds; effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} Con; cure: 1 save.
aa51c8bf-a49c-4a67-ae56-05985d98cc04:
Each sorcerer has a source of magic somewhere in her heritage that grants her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, an additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}, and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This source can represent a blood relation or an extreme event involving a creature somewhere in the family's past. For example, a sorcerer might have a dragon as a distant relative or her grandfather might have signed a terrible contract with a devil. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways as the sorcerer gains levels. A sorcerer must pick one bloodline upon taking her first level of sorcerer. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
Filled with magical power that screams for release, sorcery is not so much a calling as a blessing â€” or a curse. For some sorcerers, this arcane birthright manifests in subtle and carefully controlled ways, assisting in their manipulation of others or the pursuit of lofty goals. For others, it is wild and unpredictable, the primal and explosive lashing out of a power greater than themselves.
At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, a sorcerer learns an additional spell, derived from her bloodline. These spells are in addition to the number of spells given at new levels. These spells cannot be exchanged for different spells at higher levels.
At 7th level, and every six levels thereafter, a sorcerer receives one bonus feat, chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The sorcerer must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats.
d3019347-0f8f-4198-88ca-76e3bd2d243b: Every sorcerer descends from a creature that possesses innate magic, such as dragons, fey, devils, etc. The bloodline grants the sorcerer a number of available {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, unique {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} and abilities, and helps to empower their chosen specialization.
575ede28-6044-4ba4-a271-40a26a67b1dd:
Generations ago, a demon spread its filth into your heritage. While it does not manifest in all of your kin, for you it is particularly strong. You might sometimes have urges to chaos or evil, but your destiny (and {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}) is up to you. While some would say that you are possessed, you know better. The demonic influence in your blood grows as you gain power.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Abyssal Bloodline: Augment Summoning, Bull Rush, Cleave, Empower Spell, Great Fortitude, Power Attack, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g}), Sunder Armor.

97a2b29b-d39e-4881-825e-cac827063c2b: Innate magical powers are always a tempting phenomenon, and many people are content with the extent of their powers, but overwhelming mages strive to improve the sheer capacity of their powers.
20172559-dc39-4337-958c-91ac95a4506a: Seekers often look to ancient devices, old tomes, and strange magical items in order to learn more about their sorcerous bloodlines. As a result of this curiosity and thanks to an innate knack at deciphering the strange and weird, a seeker gains {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}. In addition, at 1st level, a seeker adds half his sorcerer level on Trickery skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} (minimum +1).
2e998228-321b-4234-b236-b21914e77b8f: Some undead are susceptible to your mind-affecting {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. Undead creatures are treated as humanoids for the purposes of determining which spells affect them.
490ade6c-f221-4c72-ae0a-ab12c96498ed:
Somewhere in your family's history, a relative made a deal with a devil, and that pact has influenced your family line ever since. In you, it manifests in direct and obvious ways, granting you powers and abilities. While your fate is still your own, you can't help but wonder if your ultimate reward is bound to the Pit. You can draw upon the power of Hell, although you must be wary of its corrupting influence. Such power does not come without a price.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Infernal Bloodline: Blind Fight, Combat Expertise, Deceitful, Disarm, Extend Spell, Iron Will, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g} Penetration.
f95ef84b-0f3a-4d2d-81da-f7c52c3b3aef: Sorcerers are powerful arcane spellcasters, very effective in combat. Unlike the other arcane spellcasters, they can use a limited array of spells which makes them less flexible in various situations. However, they can cast more spells before they need a rest.
3e7af657-28c9-4cec-bb56-bd3ac19ed192: Sorcerers are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}. They are not proficient with any type of armor or shield. Armor interferes with a sorcerer's gestures, which can cause her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with somatic components to fail.
01d09808-e8e1-4224-8b63-a9baaaafc8de: Sorcerers can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
8e623319-82f7-474f-b7bc-8070c41175a8: Sorcerers excel at casting a selection of favored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} frequently, making them powerful battle mages. As they become familiar with a specific and ever-widening set of spells, sorcerers often discover new and versatile ways of making use of magics other spellcasters might overlook. Their bloodlines also grant them additional abilities, assuring that no two sorcerers are ever quite alike.
e3287e02-3b7f-4bfe-8820-09708639815b: Sorcerers gain their magical powers through strange and mysterious ways. While most might be content with their strange powers, some adventure far and wide in search of a greater understanding of the genesis and history of their eldritch talents. These {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} are known as seekers, after their obsession with researching ancient texts and obscure ruins for any clues they can find about their heritage and histories.
484494c2-158d-4239-8ed4-bced5411fb87: Starting at 1st level, you can grow claws as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. These claws are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}, allowing you to make two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} as a full attack using your full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. Each of these attacks deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier (1d3 if you are Small). At 5th level, these claws are considered magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}. At 7th level, the damage increases by one step to 1d6 points of damage (1d4 if you are Small). At 11th level, these claws deal an additional 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} on a successful hit. You can use your claws for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.

048b434c-af36-4a3b-9f91-89cc38878d12: Starting at 1st level, you can make a melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that causes a living creature to become shaken for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your sorcerer level (minimum 1). If you touch a shaken creature with this ability, it becomes frightened for 1 round if it has fewer {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than your sorcerer level. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
c54884f7-54ae-415b-9ada-c0ba48913012: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash a bolt of magic force as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. This bolt deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
56a39c54-ad75-4e87-b985-b67d3f7e2e32: Starting at 1st level, you can unleash a ray of heavenly fire as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}. Against evil creatures, this ray deals ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This damage is divine and not subject to energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g}. This ray {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} good creatures of (1d4 + 1 for every two sorcerer levels you possess) points of damage. A good creature cannot benefit from your heavenly fire more than once per day. Neutral creatures are neither harmed nor healed by this effect. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (or {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier for an empyreal sorcerer).

12a8cb3b-adb8-4152-adc0-09c4b793d1b1: Stories often tell of kitsune with multiple tails, but not many realize that fewer than one kitsune in every thousand has this potential, and those that do usually have a magical quirk in their blood or have been blessed by their race's deific matron. As a result, most that harness the mystic powers of their newfound tails often gain sorcerous powers, becoming nine-tailed heirs.
8377e761-e683-4002-9304-2a1c2d1595bd:
The capricious nature of the fey runs in your family due to some intermingling of fey blood or magic. You are more emotional than most, prone to bouts of joy and rage. You have always had a tie to the natural world, and as your power increases, so does the influence of the fey over your magic.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Fey Bloodline: Dodge, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Lightning Reflexes, Agile Maneuvers, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Quicken Spell, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g}).
f3041793-f0c7-4c3e-aff6-386ce23fb680:
The power of the elements resides in you, and at times you can hardly control its fury. This influence comes from an elemental outsider in your family history or a time when you or your relatives were exposed to a powerful elemental force. Air infuses your being, and you can draw upon its power in times of need.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Elemental Bloodline: Dodge, Empower Spell, Great Fortitude, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Lightning Reflexes, Power Attack, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Weapon Finesse.

9b3ca45a-7ff3-48fb-8ffb-083413417aca:
The taint of the grave runs through your family. Perhaps one of your ancestors became a powerful lich or vampire, or maybe you were born dead before suddenly returning to life. Either way, the forces of death move through you and touch your every action. You can call upon the foul powers of the afterlife. Unfortunately, the more you draw upon them, the closer you come to joining them.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Undead Bloodline: Combat Casting, Great Fortitude, Iron Will, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g}), Spell Focus, Greater Spell Focus, Toughness, Diehard.

188be43b-d014-4a6a-aed5-3d801ceffbeb: This character now has dragon claws.
df288d63-b279-484b-b2a2-5f9841621e32: This character now has serpent's fang.

f9f3823c-d679-436a-8cbe-c84bf3ad93ae:
Your bloodline carries the lingering stain of ancient serpent races that ruled when the world was young; your forebears were likely favored slaves anointed by their reptilian masters and gifted with their cold cunning and subtle manipulation. While deception and a mesmeric charm are your birthright, you may struggle for truth in spite of your heritage. The treacherous and yet hypnotic serpent's blood that flows through you taints your magic with a sinuous and seductive grace.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Serpentine Bloodline: Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Deceitful, Deft Hands, Persuasive, Reach {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g}, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g}), Stealthy.
8ad34c90-a7d0-46e0-b5cb-55ff64bb497a:
Your bloodline is blessed by a celestial power, either from a celestial ancestor or through divine intervention. Although this power drives you along the path of good, your fate (and alignment) is your own to determine. Your celestial heritage grants you a great many powers, but they come at a price. The lords of the higher planes are watching you and your actions closely.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Celestial Bloodline: Dodge, Extend Spell, Iron Will, Agile Maneuvers, Augment Summoning, Superior Summoning, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g}), Weapon Finesse.
9549b71b-ad03-430e-837b-1cda11ff1174:
Your family has always been skilled in the eldritch art of magic. While many of your relatives were accomplished wizards, your powers developed without the need for study and practice. Magic comes naturally to you, but as you gain levels, you must take care to prevent the power from overwhelming you.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g} of the Arcane Bloodline: Combat Casting, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Iron Will, Reach {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spell{/g}, Skill Focus ({g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g}), Spell Focus, Greater Spell Focus, Spell Penetration.
8e7b80fa-f1bb-4026-ba80-ffc6ca9453bf: Your heavenly power derives from insight rather than force of personality.
b4d9282b-f16e-43b5-ab61-6c335a44f79f: Your magic comes from the knowledge and traditions that your bloodline accumulated through the generations, not just from force of personality. You use your {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, rather than your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, to determine all class features and effects relating to your sorcerer class, such as bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} per day, the maximum spell level you can cast, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of your spells, and the number of daily uses of your bloodline powers.
47e611d4-860a-4f55-8934-03aefac2f61e: Your powers of compulsion can affect even bestial creatures. Whenever you cast a mind-affecting {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, it affects animals, magical beasts, monstrous humanoids, and vermin as if they were humanoids who understood your language.
